spocs.title: The Best Books for First-Time Parents
spocs.excerpt: These books are the perfect way to laugh and learn between naps.

spocs.title: Onboarding New Hires? Here's How to Prepare
spocs.excerpt: When the onboarding process is clear, new employees become productive faster, feel secure in their new role, and are more engaged—everybody wins.

spocs.title: Teamwork a Mess? Here's a Better Way to Organize Work
spocs.excerpt: Instead of being subject to anyone who walks by with a “quick question,” follow along to learn how to create a more productive way to file and track work.

spocs.title: 5 Ways to Save Time With Asana
spocs.excerpt: These five Asana features will help you keep everyone in the loop and on track—and save time.

recommendations.title: The jaw-dropping story behind an NFL coach's search for his family
recommendations.excerpt: Carol Briggs placed her newborn son on the bed and removed all of his clothes. She tried to find herself in his face, searching his mouth, his nose, his eyes. "Not yet," she thought. She saw only his father.

recommendations.title: How to Make a Big Decision
recommendations.excerpt: Have no fear. An emerging science can now help you choose.  Mr. Johnson writes about science and the history of innovation.

recommendations.title: Rethinking Manhattan’s Grid
recommendations.excerpt: What do you get when you layer the Barcelona “superblock” and the Dutch woonerf onto Manhattan’s grid? Streets that are for people.  Mobility in New York City is at a tipping point.

recommendations.title: The Puberty Book Embraced By Preteens, Parents, and Sex Educators Alike
recommendations.excerpt: I first learned about periods from a cartoon. Just before I started middle school, my mom handed me a large white book with three cartoon girls on the cover, each wrapped in a towel, dripping wet, as though fresh out of the shower.

recommendations.title: Bland on Blonde: why the old rock music canon is finished
recommendations.excerpt: Rock’s flight into seriousness in the 1970s had many ill effects. There was prog rock, jamming, not releasing singles – and the idea that the couple of decades since Elvis had produced enough music of sufficient worth to produce a canon.

recommendations.title: Why Taking Time Off From Work Is Good for Your Productivity
recommendations.excerpt: Great news: taking time off is good for your career.  Usually, taking time off is considered the antithesis of a good work ethic. You’re supposed to be productive, and that means busy at all times, right? But as it turns out, busy is always be better.

recommendations.title: The secret to successful BBQ pork butt and brisket is science
recommendations.excerpt: Imagine this nightmare Labor Day scenario. You've invited a large group of friends over for pulled BBQ pork or a delicious beef brisket.

recommendations.title: Why You Should Tell Your Co-Workers How Much Money You Make
recommendations.excerpt: It’s unlawful for private sector employers to prohibit employees from discussing wages and compensation. Take advantage of that protection.  So how much do you make?

recommendations.title: How To Get Kids To Do Chores: Does The Maya Method Work?
recommendations.excerpt: If hadn't seen it with my own eyes, I wouldn't have believed it.  But there it was, right in front of me: A preteen voluntarily doing chores around the house.

recommendations.title: The best note-taking apps for class, work, and life
recommendations.excerpt: You might want a note-taking app as an artist, to take notes during a meeting to remember important feedback, or to jot down insights from a meaningful panel. Maybe you’re a celebrity who needs to publish a public apology to social media, and you need more space than a typical post affords.

recommendations.title: How Three Tokelau Teenagers Survived Being Lost in the Ocean for 51 Days
recommendations.excerpt: Three boys. One boat. Fifty-one days at sea. A harrowing story of unlikely survival.  A crewman on a commercial tuna-fishing boat was the first to spot it: something shiny and metallic in the water off the ship's bow.

recommendations.title: The Silence After the Hit-and-Run
recommendations.excerpt: The sun had just risen when Bernadette Karna, dressed in her American Airlines uniform, set out on her commute: a taxi from her Upper East Side apartment in Manhattan to 41st Street and Lexington Avenue, then a shuttle to John F. Kennedy International Airport.

recommendations.title: The hidden suffering behind the Brazilian coffee that jump-starts American mornings
recommendations.excerpt: TANHACU, Brazil — When police rescued Abelar Rebouças from a coffee plantation in southern Brazil, he was bone thin. The 51-year-old worked long days for a month in the hot sun, hauling 15-gallon bags of coffee beans.

recommendations.title: Lost in the Storm
recommendations.excerpt: Wayne Dailey sat in a waiting area at a Houston hospital, anxious for word about his wife. He and his sister stared at the television to distract themselves. It was Wednesday, Aug.

recommendations.title: When Slavery Is Erased From Plantations
recommendations.excerpt: The story of Sally Hemings—the enslaved woman who bore six of Thomas Jefferson’s children—is told from the basement of Jefferson’s mansion at his Monticello plantation in Charlottesville, Virginia.

recommendations.title: Susan Brownmiller on How The Village Voice Made Her a Writer
recommendations.excerpt: The Village Voice, closed down yesterday after 63 years in business, was where I learned to write. It took me awhile, because I was uncomfortable with the “I” word.

recommendations.title: Inside the Haywire World of Beirut's Electricity Brokers
recommendations.excerpt: A fading skirt of tawny light sets the city aglitter. The glare undulates for miles across the hillsides, touching cozy homes and glitzy high-rises and bullet-perforated storefronts.

recommendations.title: ‘Get the Nazi out of New York.’ The secret operation to deport the last living Nazi defendant in the U.S. was a rare success.
recommendations.excerpt: He had watched eight Nazi war criminals die on American soil long after federal judges had ordered them to leave, so when the email came in early July with news that Germany would finally take the last surviving Nazi defendant in the United States, Eli Rosenbaum tried not to worry.

recommendations.title: Sleep Well, Lead Better
recommendations.excerpt: How much sleep do you get each night? Most of us know that eight hours is the recommended amount, but with work, family, and social commitments often consuming more than 16 hours of the day, it can seem impossible to make the math work.

recommendations.title: Precious as Silver, Vanilla Brings Cash and Crime to Madagascar
recommendations.excerpt: SAMBAVA, Madagascar — Bright moonlight reflected off broad banana leaves, but it was still hard to see the blue twine laced through the undergrowth, a tripwire meant to send the unwary tumbling to the ground.
